727307f-a.text:
Main Avenue, north side, east from 8th Street (Welling Court), showing some remaining old homes, near Hallets Cove, Astoria.
June 2, 1927
P. L. Sperr

727300f-a.text:
Main Avenue, adjoining the N. E. corner of Vernon Boulevard, showing an old farmhouse near Hallets Cove, Astoria.
P. L. Sperr  March 9, 1931
727300f-a.folder: Main Avenue & Vernon Boulevard, Queens, NY

727301f-a.text:
Main Avenue, adjoining the N. E. corner of Vernon Boulevard,
showing an old Rapelje house.
View 1: P. L. Sperr  June 2, 1927
View 2: George D. Chinn  April 27, 1940
727301f-a.folder: Main Avenue & Vernon Boulevard, Queens, NY

727301f-b.text:
Main Avenue, adjoining the N. E. corner of Vernon Boulevard,
showing an old Rapelje house.
View 1: P. L. Sperr  June 2, 1927
View 2: George D. Chinn  April 27, 1940
727301f-b.folder: Main Avenue & Vernon Boulevard, Queens, NY

727302f-a.text:
(1)
Main Ave., adjoining the N.W. corner of Vernon Boulevard, showing the Rapelye Mansion. There is a dispute as to its identity. Eugene L. Armbruster states it is the Cornelius Rapelye house; one Van Rieper states it to be the Tavern; another, Mr. Roe S. Johnson states that this was the Trafford house and was also used as a tavern. Eugene W. Armbruster's history on this subject is that John Trafford married Grace Rapelye, sister of C. Rapelye, who erected this house in 1780.
It was occupied by C. R. Trafford in 1873.
April 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collectiom.
727302f-a.folder: Main Avenue & Vernon Boulevard, Queens, NY

727302f-b.text:
(1)
Main Ave., adjoining the N.W. corner of Vernon Boulevard, showing the Rapelye Mansion. There is a dispute as to its identity. Eugene L. Armbruster states it is the Cornelius Rapelye house; one Van Rieper states it to be the Tavern; another, Mr. Roe S. Johnson states that this was the Trafford house and was also used as a tavern. Eugene W. Armbruster's history on this subject is that John Trafford married Grace Rapelye, sister of C. Rapelye, who erected this house in 1780.
It was occupied by C. R. Trafford in 1873.

727302f-b.folder: Main Avenue & Vernon Boulevard, Queens, NY

727303f-a.text:
(1)
Main Ave., adjoining the N.W. corner of Vernon Boulevard, showing the Rapelje Mansion, erected in 1780 by Jacobus Riker at 29 Main Street (old number). This house was occupied by the family for over a hundred years. It was still standing in October 1934.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing the west side of the house.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, showing also the front of the house facing on Main Ave.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
727303f-a.folder: Main Avenue & Vernon Boulevard, Queens, NY
